pathMarkConfig.title: Configure Your Media Library
pathMarkConfig.tip.description: Use this tool to configure path marks for your media library. Path marks help organize and categorize your content.
pathMarkConfig.tip.pathMemory: Edit the path in the address bar, press Enter after selecting a directory, or right-click to enter a directory - the system will remember your last location and use it as the default next time.
pathMarkConfig.tip.syncImmediately: When enabled, marks will be synced immediately after being set.
pathMarkConfig.warning.syncDataNote: Note: If there is a lot of data, synchronization may take several minutes.
pathMarkConfig.tip.expirationDescription: After sync completes, the mark will be re-synced after the specified time. If set too short, it may cause frequent re-syncing and affect performance.
pathMarkConfig.confirm.deleteMarkQuestio: Are you sure you want to delete this mark?
pathMarkConfig.tip.selectMarksToCopy: Select marks to copy from an entry
pathMarkConfig.warning.noMatches: No matches found. Please check your configuration.
pathMarkConfig.tip.fixedMediaLibraryDesc: Resources matched by this mark will be associated with the selected media library.
pathMarkConfig.tip.dynamicMediaLibraryDe: Extract the media library name from the path. If the media library does not exist, it will be created automatically.
pathMarkConfig.tip.layerToMediaLibraryDe: Which layer's directory name to use as media library name. 0 = matched item, 1 = parent, etc.
pathMarkConfig.tip.regexToMediaLibraryDe: Optional regex to extract media library name. Uses first capture group or full match.
pathMark.resource.explanation: Resource marks identify file system entries (files or directories) that should be treated as resources in your media library.
pathMark.resource.isResourceBoundary.des: When enabled, this mark defines a boundary for resource detection. Child entries won't inherit this mark's resource configuration.
pathMark.layer.description: 0 = Root path, 1 = First child level, etc. The layer defines which directory depth to match.
pathMark.regex.description: Regular expression pattern to match against the relative path from root.
pathMark.applyScope.matchedOnly.descript: Only apply to the exact matched path
pathMark.applyScope.matchedAndSubdirecto: Apply to matched path and all paths inside it
pathMark.priority.description: Lower values are processed first. Use to control mark application order when multiple marks match.
pathMark.property.explanation: Property Mark: Add property values (like tags, categories) to resources.
pathMark.property.settingsDescription: Select a property and set where its value comes from.
pathMark.property.importantNote: Property marks don't create resources. Only resources whose paths match a Resource Mark will receive property values.
pathMark.mediaLibrary.explanation: Media Library Mark: Categorize resources into a specific media library.
pathMark.mediaLibrary.settingsDescriptio: Select a target library, or extract it from the path automatically.
pathMark.mediaLibrary.importantNote: Media library marks don't create resources. Only resources whose paths match a Resource Mark will be linked to the media library.
pathMarkConfig.tip.clickToEditRightClick: Click to edit, right-click to delete
pathMarkGuide.welcome.title: Welcome to Path Marks
pathMarkGuide.welcome.description: Path Marks help you organize your media library by defining rules on file paths. You can specify which files are resources, assign properties, and associate them with media libraries.
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.title: Three Types of Marks
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.subtitle: Each mark type serves a different purpose in organizing your content.
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.resourceDesc: Identifies files or folders as resources in your library. Use layer or regex to match paths.
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.resourceImportan: Resource Mark is the foundation - only after setting it up can you view and manage your resources on the Resource page. Without it, the system won't know which files to track.
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.propertyDesc: Assigns property values (like tags, categories) to matched resources automatically.
pathMarkGuide.markTypes.mediaLibraryDesc: Associates resources with a specific media library for better organization.
pathMarkGuide.configure.title: How to Configure
pathMarkGuide.configure.subtitle: Follow these steps to set up your path marks.
pathMarkGuide.configure.step1: Navigate to a folder in the file tree and select it.
pathMarkGuide.configure.step2: Right-click or use the Add Mark button to create marks.
pathMarkGuide.configure.step3: Configure the matching rules and preview the affected paths.
pathMarkGuide.sync.title: Sync & Management
pathMarkGuide.sync.subtitle: Marks need to be synced to generate actual data.
pathMarkGuide.sync.explanation: Creating marks alone doesn't immediately create resources. Syncing is the process that reads your marks and generates the corresponding data (resources, properties, library associations).
pathMarkGuide.sync.point1: By default, auto-sync is enabled and will run automatically after marks change. You can disable auto-sync in settings if needed.
pathMarkGuide.sync.point2: If auto-sync is disabled, use the "Pending Sync" button to manually trigger synchronization.
pathMarkConfig.label.nextStepHint: Next step: View all configured marks, or configure Resource Profiles to define enhancers, players, and other settings
pathMarkConfig.label.keepResourcesOnPath: Keep resource identity on path change
pathMarkConfig.tip.keepResourcesOnPathCh: Normally, a resource record is created for each resource path. When enabled, a marker file (bakabase.json) will be generated in resource folders. During the next sync, if the resource path has changed, the system will not create a new resource record for the new path. Instead, it will use the marker file to locate the original resource record and update its path.
